intro: Clermontia coerulea var. brevidens, commonly known as the short-stemmed bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
